subject: RE: Best person?
body:
Sorry about that! 
 
Pam – I am available tomorrow am ET.
 
Thank you,
Jennifer

To:
 Jennifer Barbieri <j.barbieri@lcwmail.com>; Accounting <accounting@lcwmail.com>
Subject:

Hi Michelle- happy to review the accounting @ email with you. I am available tomorrow am for a call.
 
Jennifer 
Sent from my iPhone

accounting@lcwmail.com
> wrote:
﻿ 
HI JENNIFER
Could we do a Zoom and go through the 
accounting@lcwmail.com
 together?
It would help me during this transition.
We could do as short as half an hour to get started, then if we could meet a few times in a week to work our way through everything new and old.
 
Pamela Coulter

subject: FW: Question about Digital Learning Programs with LCW
body:
Hi Nicole – I spoke with Hannah about this request below and she is looking for the actual number of elearnings/microlearnings per year. Do we have this info somewhere that is easily accessible? I know Compas was only used starting in April 2022 and Hannah is looking for history.
 
Thank you,
Jennifer
 
From:
 Hannah Strack <h.strack@lcwmail.com> 
Sent:
 Wednesday, February 1, 2023 2:26 PM
To:
 Jennifer Barbieri <j.barbieri@lcwmail.com>
Subject:
 Question about Digital Learning Programs with LCW
 
Hi Jennifer!
 
I hope you’re doing well. 
 
I’m reaching out to ask a technical question around the amount of micro-learnings & e-learnings we’ve sold within the past 1-5 years (or whatever data is available for the most recent time). 
 
I’m doing a deep dive of e-learning and micro-learning programs and was curious how many of these programs we have sold. I’m assuming this number may be small since the pricing structure around the programs are now different (using the subscription model now vs. whatever we were using before). Could you please check as you have time and let me know?
 
Thanks for your help and let me know if you need any additional info for clarification.
 
Have a great rest of your Wednesday!
 
Best,
Hannah
 
------------------------------------------------------
Hannah Strack
Business Development Associate 
(North Carolina)
Email: 
h.strack@lcwmail.com
Phone:
 
+1 773-828-1202 [EST]
 
   
www
 
|
 
Twitter
 
|
 
Facebook
 
|
 
LinkedIn

body:

Thank you,
Jennifer
 
 
------------------------------------------------------
Jennifer Barbieri

Lake Forest, IL 60045

subject: RE: Form 1099-NEC
body:
Hi Maria – I can tell you what happened here. We have 2 Quickbooks accounts. One for pre acquisition and one for post (April 1 2022 to present). Randy ran the 1099s for Q1 and I compiled it with Q2-Q4. Since the amounts from below (Q1) are less than the threshold for filing the 1099s, it was not included in the combined total filing. That being said, we can reissue with the new amount.
 
@Pamela Coulter
 would you be able to do this? We filed the 1099s through QBO.
 
Thank you,
Jennifer
 
From:
 Maria Fagrelius <m.fagrelius@lcwmail.com> 
Sent:
 Wednesday, February 15, 2023 5:17 PM
To:
 Pamela Coulter <p.coulter@lcwmail.com>; Jennifer Barbieri <j.barbieri@lcwmail.com>
Cc:
 Accounting <accounting@lcwmail.com>
Subject:
 FW: Form 1099-NEC
 
Hi! Can you please check per email chain below? I received an email today from the translator:
“
I don't think it is resolved. I did receive a paper Form 1099-NEC and it says $1399.90 like the online form. I think the amount should be $1591.82.”
Kindly let me know if you could please check our records. Thank you!
 
 
María
 
From:
 Maria Fagrelius 
Sent:
 Monday, January 30, 2023 7:57 AM
To:
 Accounting <
accounting@lcwmail.com
>
Subject:
 FW: Form 1099-NEC
 
Hello!
Can you look into this please? See below from Miyo, a translator.
Thank you very much!!!
 
 
María
 
From:
 miyo tat <
miyot@comcast.net
> 
Sent:
 Monday, January 30, 2023 12:29 AM
To:
 Maria Fagrelius <
m.fagrelius@lcwmail.com
>
Subject:
 Form 1099-NEC
 
Hi Maria, 
 
I received Form 1099-NEC. 
It looks like not all of the payment is included in the total amount. 
I looked at "Payment History" in QuickBooks against my record and it looks like the following two payments are not included: 
 
Amount $97.64; Job 21180: American Honda; Invoice # 3286; Date Invoiced 12/30/2021; Payment Received 1/10/2022 
Amount $94.28; Job 22009: NuVasive CoC module; Invoice # 3307; Date Invoiced: 3/6/2022; Payment received 3/10/2022 
 
Could you check your record and let me know? 
Thank you very much. 
Sincerely,
Miyo M. Tat
ATA-Certified English-to-Japanese Translator
miyot@comcast.net
425-228-4596

subject: Re: Chase Ink
body:
Sounds good! I’ll exclude these transactions in the import.
Btw - sleep is totally underrated. I get it 😉
Sent from my iPhone
On Feb 15, 2023, at 4:42 PM, Randall Stieghorst <r.stieghorst@lcwmail.com> wrote:
﻿
 
I actually thought it was strange that RP had IDI’s on her card. It must have been an issue with the import…because those always went through Briza’s. As long as it matches…and the transactions are already on Briza’s, I’d just delete/exclude them. 
 
Normally, at the end of the year, I try to tell people not to use their cards for the last week – so I can get the credit card balance to match QB exactly. If I see those 2 numbers matching on any specific day of the year, I sleep better 
😉
 
-R
 
 
From:
 Jennifer Barbieri <j.barbieri@lcwmail.com> 
Sent:
 Wednesday, February 15, 2023 15:05
To:
 Randall Stieghorst <r.stieghorst@lcwmail.com>
Subject:
 RE: Chase Ink
 
Hi Randy – I check Chuck’s card and made sure the expenses are in QBO are they are. This is where it gets weird – for RP. In QBO the import for RP’s card, I see some transactions for IDI in July for $1.8K BUT in the actual statement, the charge was made on Briza’s card and was already imported and booked in QBO. Can you confirm this is actually made by RP or did something get crossed in the import. Here is the statement I have for July:
 
<image001.png>
 
From:
 Randall Stieghorst <
r.stieghorst@lcwmail.com
> 
Sent:
 Wednesday, February 15, 2023 2:52 PM
To:
 Jennifer Barbieri <
j.barbieri@lcwmail.com
>
Subject:
 RE: Chase Ink
 
Ouch 
😉
 
It’s strange that the downloaded transactions don’t auto-match to reconciled transactions…but I don’t get a lot of things with Chase & QB!
 
Thx,
R
 
 
From:
 Jennifer Barbieri <
j.barbieri@lcwmail.com
> 
Sent:
 Wednesday, February 15, 2023 13:41
To:
 Randall Stieghorst <
r.stieghorst@lcwmail.com
>
Subject:
 RE: Chase Ink
 
Hi Randy – I actually entered in the 2022 expenses for these cards manually when I reconciled through the end of 2022 to close the year out. But – 2023 is a different story 
😉
 
From:
 Randall Stieghorst <
r.stieghorst@lcwmail.com
> 
Sent:
 Wednesday, February 15, 2023 2:27 PM
To:
 Jennifer Barbieri <
j.barbieri@lcwmail.com
>
Subject:
 Chase Ink
 
Hey Jenn,
Now that we have Chuck, Sarah, RP, and Dan syncing to QB, we’ll need to do a reconciliation of the credit card accounts to capture all of the 2022 expenses. I’m guessing the payment transactions just got entered based on whatever the actual bill was, even if the charges from those different consultants never got entered. I’m not really sure how Alsu/David reconciled the credit card without those entries…but…
 
-R
 
 
Randall Stieghorst
 
Language & Culture Worldwide, LLC
4753 N Broadway St, 2
nd
 Floor
Chicago, IL 60640
+1(773)
 
828-6781
 
<image002.png>

subject: FW: Podcast Honorarium Tax Question
body:
Hi Jake – so this is coming from our tax person directly. Please see below.
 
From:
 Schneider, Jill <jill.schneider@eisneramper.com> 
Sent:
 Wednesday, February 15, 2023 3:57 PM
To:
 Jennifer Barbieri <j.barbieri@lcwmail.com>
Subject:
 RE: Podcast Honorarium Tax Question
 
Hi Jennifer,
Either way gifts deductibility is limited to $25 per person. It doesn’t matter if gift card or giftly
 
Best,
 
JIll Schneider
 
Tax Director, Private Client Services
 
Eisner Advisory Group LLC
D
: 516-864-8895 | 
M
: 516-551-4564 
 
Effective January 30, 2023, please note that we have moved from Syosset to 175 Broadhollow Road, Suite 250, Melville NY 11757.
 
From:
 Jennifer Barbieri <
j.barbieri@lcwmail.com
> 
Sent:
 Wednesday, February 15, 2023 2:40 PM
To:
 Schneider, Jill <
jill.schneider@eisneramper.com
>
Subject:
 [External] FW: Podcast Honorarium Tax Question
 
Hi Jill – can you weigh in here. I’m not 100% on this and I don’t want to give bad advice 
😉
 
Thank you,
Jennifer
 
From:
 Jake Pieczynski <
j.pieczynski@lcwmail.com
> 
Sent:
 Wednesday, February 15, 2023 2:08 PM
To:
 Jennifer Barbieri <
j.barbieri@lcwmail.com
>
Subject:
 RE: Podcast Honorarium Tax Question
 
Hi Jennifer,
 
I hope you’re doing well this week! When you have a chance could you please let me know what you think about the message below?
 
Thanks so much for your help!
 
Jake
 
Jake Pieczynski
(he/him/his)
Marketing & Communications Manager
LCW 
 
   
www
 
|
 
Twitter
 
|
 
Facebook
 
|
 
LinkedIn
 
From:
 Jake Pieczynski 
Sent:
 Thursday, February 9, 2023 10:32 AM
To:
 Jennifer Barbieri <
j.barbieri@lcwmail.com
>
Subject:
 Podcast Honorarium Tax Question
 
Hi Jennifer,
 
I hope you’re doing well! I’m writing to you this morning with sort of a unique question. We’re starting to begin production on the next season of our podcast and we’re going to offer guests a $50 honorarium for their time. Alisa wanted me to check with you on what the best way to give that honorarium would be for tax purposes. We were originally thinking of sending a gift card, but Alisa noted that providing a gift via the Giftly website may be better for taxes. Do you have any reccomendation on what we should do?
 
Thank you for your help!
 
Jake
 
Jake Pieczynski
(he/him/his)
Marketing & Communications Manager
LCW 
 
   
www
 
|
 
Twitter
 
|
 
Facebook
 
|
 
LinkedIn
 
"EisnerAmper" is the brand name under which EisnerAmper LLP and Eisner Advisory Group LLC provide professional services. EisnerAmper LLP and Eisner Advisory Group LLC are independently owned firms that practice in an alternative practice structure in accordance with the AICPA Code of Professional Conduct and applicable law, regulations and professional standards. EisnerAmper LLP is a licensed CPA firm that provides attest services, and Eisner Advisory Group LLC and its subsidiary entities provide tax and business consulting services to clients and provide staff and other administrative resources to EisnerAmper LLP. Eisner Advisory Group LLC and its subsidiary entities are not licensed CPA firms.
EisnerAmper LLP and Eisner Advisory Group LLC are member firms of EisnerAmper Global Ltd., a network of legally independent firms, and of Allinial Global, an association of legally independent accounting and consulting firms. EisnerAmper Global Ltd., Allinial Global, and their member firms and correspondent firms (including EisnerAmper LLP and Eisner Advisory Group LLC and its affiliated entities) are not responsible for, do not accept liability for, and do not owe any duty with respect to the services or advice provided by any other member or correspondent firms.
Any tax advice contained in this memorandum (including any attachments) is not intended for and cannot be used, for the purpose of (i) avoiding penalties imposed by the Internal Revenue Code or (ii) promoting, marketing, or recommending any transaction.
CONFIDENTIAL AND PROPRIETARY: This email message is intended only for the use of the individual or entity to which it is addressed and may contain information that is privileged and confidential. Unless specifically stated, it is not intended to be relied upon by any person or persons other than the individual or entity named above and no warranties or representations are made or intended to persons or entities not named above. If the reader is not the intended recipient, you are hereby notified that any dissemination, distribution or copying of this communication is strictly prohibited, and any disclosure to the reader shall not compromise or waive the attorney-client, accountant-client, or other privileges as to this communication or otherwise. If you have received this communication in error, please notify us immediately by telephone, return this message to the address above and delete all copies. Thank you
